channel.title: Pj. Opium - Aren't you tired of Delta and PI?
channel.description:
[CENTER][IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Development%20Pics/title.png[/img] Welcome to the Pj. Opium! This thread covers all of the updates and revision history of the Pj. Opium progress. The Pj. Opium team consists of only me at the moment, but I might request some help from some of my pals later on when I get really techy. Once I get all the basics done, I will create a team project to unravel my source further on.
Pj. Opium was created with future evolution in thought. I feel that the current bases lack in player-wanted layouts and the server programming isnt designed with the person in mind, but more to give a feeling of stability without quality. Some people attempted to fix this by adding new features, but it horribly destroyed the quality of the stability because they didn't understand conventions or know how to correctly program. My goal is to combine great stability AND quality to create an always wanted server with great features. Pj. Opium will have a great environment for skillers and PKers alike. Combat will be made to be extremely realistic, with both timing and hits right.
Soon, this project will evolve from the basics stage, and go onto the Alpha stage. I will need alpha testers to test common bugs. I will try, to the best of my ability, to create a server base where there are absolutely no dupes, glitches, nor bugs. I will also try to reawaken the once proud RuneScape feeling.
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Development%20Pics/howitstarted.png[/img] So for a couple days I have been looking for something to work on, since I hate not being productive. I was recently a big user of RL, and so I was browsing posts and commenting, blah, the usual. I got bored so I went onto R-S and registered this account just to see what all the fuss was about R-S being the most advanced RSPS forums to date, and so I go onto these R-S forums and I look in the downloads section just to see how productive people are here, and so all I see is this:
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Development%20Pics/typesofreleases.png[/img]
I don't want to make a full screen shot, but believe me, almost all sources were either delta or PI. I threw up a little in my mouth. So, now i'm going to start a fresh new base, straight from Hyperion.
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Development%20Pics/updates.png[/img] [B][U]4/15/2011[/U][/B] Download Hyperion and Nickname's client. Configure login packets for Hyperion to accept client. Finally succeeded with logging in.
[B][U]4/16/2011[/U][/B] Masterbate early to get brain active and start hardcoding. Inject Dentri's emote system, still need gfx though. Completely mess up by attempting to fix chatbox refresh. Wanted to rest a little, so made some dialogues for later.
[B][U]4/17/2011 [/U][/B] Finished skill additions, but can only gain by ::setlevel. Fixed prayer glitch where prayer didn't update with ::setlevel. Made some useful commands for later. Added a shitload of more dialogues. Minor login adjustments, playing around a bit to test.
[B][U]4/18/2011 [/U][/B] FINALLY got all gfx for emotes. Got skillcape gfx and emotes also. Fixed gameframe transformations, didn't update all buttons, etc. Added NPC spawning (still need walking and attack implementations.) Teleporting, correct timing with animations/gfx. Item support! Finally got the new welcome screen (thanks TankPro) Ape atol maps fixed, just switched the used object IDs till I finally got them right. Prayer requirements work now, just need to add actually working prayer ;] Friends list support added, just need to fix it's savings.
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Development%20Pics/media.png[/img][IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Media/login.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Media/emotes.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Media/skillgaining.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Media/teleporting.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Media/itemsupport.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Media/logininterface.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Media/prayerreqs.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Media/friendslist.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i1191.photobucket.com/albums/z469/OpiumPro/Development%20Pics/credits.png[/img] [B]Graham[/B] for his sexy framework. [B]Nickname[/B] for his great client. List will be added to once I start needing help. [/CENTER]

& If you need any Testers, Give me a Quick PM

item.dc:creator: @X_Entinity_X X Entinity X
item.description:
@X_Entinity_X wrote:

I like the fact that your trying and you want to learn and I respect that good luck, but the fact that Project Insanity and Delta are released isn’t going to change the fact that people won’t stop using it, they like it because of how easy the networking is and how they’re packaged.

Read full topic

item.title: Pj. Opium - Aren't you tired of Delta and PI?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“Opium, post:4, topic:391507”][quote author=Nexus_ link=topic=487516.msg3572412#msg3572412 date=1303156219]
Wow, nice job. If you ever need help, i’m available.
[/quote]
Thanks.

Good luck on this, and for the record not all Delta/PI’s are bad.

Delta’s have extremely bad server management, and their process packets are disgusting. Tons of dead code, unstablness to the maximum, and you say their not bad? Ofcourse, if you have 10-20 people online, they’re OK, but if you want to build a popular server, Delta’s are painful, unless you have a 10gig RAM Dedicated server.

As for PI’s, they’re stable (im talking about the actual release by Sanity, all other releases are as good as Deltas because the new features decreased stability greatly). But, they do lack alot player input. I would like to make a base that has BOTH stableness and features with players in mind.[/quote]

Ah, but you can fix all of that though. I know a couple of deltas that has totally been rewritten. As far as pi’s I am working on a certain server with a friend to remake PI.

Read full topic

Good luck on this, and for the record not all Delta/PI’s are bad.

Delta’s have extremely bad server management, and their process packets are disgusting. Tons of dead code, unstablness to the maximum, and you say their not bad? Ofcourse, if you have 10-20 people online, they’re OK, but if you want to build a popular server, Delta’s are painful, unless you have a 10gig RAM Dedicated server.

As for PI’s, they’re stable (im talking about the actual release by Sanity, all other releases are as good as Deltas because the new features decreased stability greatly). But, they do lack alot player input. I would like to make a base that has BOTH stableness and features with players in mind.

item.title: Pj. Opium - Aren't you tired of Delta and PI?
item.dc:creator: @Opium Opium
item.description:
@Opium wrote:

[CENTER]
Welcome to the Pj. Opium! This thread covers all of the updates and revision history of the Pj. Opium progress. The Pj. Opium team consists of only me at the moment, but I might request some help from some of my pals later on when I get really techy. Once I get all the basics done, I will create a team project to unravel my source further on.

Pj. Opium was created with future evolution in thought. I feel that the current bases lack in player-wanted layouts and the server programming isnt designed with the person in mind, but more to give a feeling of stability without quality. Some people attempted to fix this by adding new features, but it horribly destroyed the quality of the stability because they didn’t understand conventions or know how to correctly program. My goal is to combine great stability AND quality to create an always wanted server with great features. Pj. Opium will have a great environment for skillers and PKers alike. Combat will be made to be extremely realistic, with both timing and hits right.

Soon, this project will evolve from the basics stage, and go onto the Alpha stage. I will need alpha testers to test common bugs. I will try, to the best of my ability, to create a server base where there are absolutely no dupes, glitches, nor bugs. I will also try to reawaken the once proud RuneScape feeling.


So for a couple days I have been looking for something to work on, since I hate not being productive. I was recently a big user of RL, and so I was browsing posts and commenting, blah, the usual. I got bored so I went onto R-S and registered this account just to see what all the fuss was about R-S being the most advanced RSPS forums to date, and so I go onto these R-S forums and I look in the downloads section just to see how productive people are here, and so all I see is this:

typesofreleases.png769×380

I don’t want to make a full screen shot, but believe me, almost all sources were either delta or PI. I threw up a little in my mouth. So, now i’m going to start a fresh new base, straight from Hyperion.


4/15/2011
Download Hyperion and Nickname’s client.
Configure login packets for Hyperion to accept client.
Finally succeeded with logging in.

4/16/2011
Masterbate early to get brain active and start hardcoding.
Inject Dentri’s emote system, still need gfx though.
Completely mess up by attempting to fix chatbox refresh.
Wanted to rest a little, so made some dialogues for later.

4/17/2011
Finished skill additions, but can only gain by ::setlevel.
Fixed prayer glitch where prayer didn’t update with ::setlevel.
Made some useful commands for later.
Added a shitload of more dialogues.
Minor login adjustments, playing around a bit to test.

4/18/2011
FINALLY got all gfx for emotes. Got skillcape gfx and emotes also.
Fixed gameframe transformations, didn’t update all buttons, etc.
Added NPC spawning (still need walking and attack implementations.)
Teleporting, correct timing with animations/gfx.
Item support!
Finally got the new welcome screen (thanks TankPro)
Ape atol maps fixed, just switched the used object IDs till I finally got them right.
Prayer requirements work now, just need to add actually working prayer ;]
Friends list support added, just need to fix it’s savings.

login.png764×497

emotes.png764×499

skillgaining.jpg761×495

teleporting.png761×498

itemsupport.png760×498

logininterface.png744×488

prayerreqs.png762×496

friendslist.png763×497


Graham for his sexy framework.
Nickname for his great client.
List will be added to once I start needing help.
[/CENTER]

Read full topic
